definitions.definition: from one end to or towards the other end of something

examples.text: They walked slowly along the road.
I looked along the shelves for the book I needed.

definitions.definition: in a line that follows the side of something long

examples.text: Houses had been built along both sides of the river.

definitions.definition: at a particular point on or next to something long

examples.text: You'll find his office just along the corridor.

wordOrigin: Old English andlang, of West Germanic origin; related to the adjective long.
